p: The fatty-acid composition was determined using a GC–FID (Agilent 7890B, Agilent Co. Ltd., Santa Clara, CA, USA) system. A capillary column (HP-INNOWAX 19091N, 30 m × 0.25 mm, 0.25 μm, Agilent Co. Ltd., Santa Clara, CA, USA) was used to separate the 37 FAMEs. The injection volume was 1 μL with 1:50 split mode. The carrier gas was helium set at a flow rate of 10 mL∙min −1. The flame gas consisted of H 2 at 35 mL∙min −1 and mixed gas at 300 mL∙min −1. The initial oven temperature was 100 °C for 2 min, later increased at the rate of 5 °C∙min −1 from 150 °C to 240 °C, and then held isothermally. The inlet temperature was 230 °C and the FID temperature was 250 °C. The acquisition was done from 1 to 55 min for a total analysis time of 65 min [ 34].
